headline: General Mills Board And Portfolio Shifts While Shares Trade Below Targets
summary: General Mills (NYSE:GIS) appointed Joan L. Bottarini as an independent director and amended its corporate bylaws. The company also agreed to sell its Muir Glen organic tomato brand to Violet Foods. These moves point to ongoing work on corporate governance structure and continued reshaping of the brand portfolio. For a global packaged foods group like General Mills, which owns brands across cereal, snacks and meals, board composition and brand mix are core parts of how it runs the business...

headline: Big Food gets leaner with divestitures and breakups as consumers turn away from packaged snacks
summary: Big Food has been selling off underperforming brands or even splitting up, as the industry faces weaker demand.
